moves.1... e5 2. f4 Nc6: He declines the offer of the pawn
moves.3. Nf3 d6 4. Bc4 Bg4: He tries to pin my knight- MISTAKE- can you spot why
moves.5. Bxf7+:
thats why- he takes the bishop and i will check with my knight on g-5 and then my q will take his bishop on g-4.

ALTHOUGH, others have pointed out - see comments- that  ...KxB,   
>N g5 , QxN,  > f4 x Q,  Bx Q and white is a piece down
moves.5... Kd7 6. O-O: leave the bishop where it is for now
moves.9. g4 Nxg4 10. hxg4 Bxg4 11. Bxc6+: this exchange has a purpose, for if he takes my bishop-
moves.11... bxc6 12. Nxe5+: wham- same trick again- i will take his bishop and also disrupt his pawns
moves.12... dxe5 13. Qxg4+ Ke8: dont take his e pawn, instead-
moves.15... Kf7 16. fxe5+: opening up the f file for the rook
moves.16... Kg7: have you noticed- my queen side pieces are still sleeping. this will prove dangerous later
moves.17. Qd5: was this a mistake - offering a q exchange
moves.17... Rf8 18. Qxd8 Rxf1+ 19. Kxf1 Rxd8 2: should have played d-3, what do you think
moves.20... Rf8+ 21. Kg2 Bh4 22. d4: desperately trying to get my pieces out
moves.24. Nd2 h5: i could get smothered by his pawns
moves.25. Nf1 Bh4 26. e6: maybe i should have played b to e-3, what do you think
moves.26... Re2 27. Bf4: i sacrifice my e pawn to get my bishop out and eat his c pawn
moves.29... Kh6 30. Ng3 g5: some have said in comments that i should have played N to f5 . That would have led to an exchange for his Bishop, and doubled his potentially dangerous g-h pawn
silly mistake on my part- over confidence is setting in
moves.38... Rd2+ 39. Kf1 Rxb2 40. Rxa6+: not good actually, for he has now disrupted my pawn chain
moves.42. d6 Kf3 43. Be1 Rb1: oh no i could get smothered by his pawns
moves.44. d7:
this is to bring my rook across to attack his king and pawns and force his rook to go after the d pawn.

 Black was threatening ...g3.  d8=Q? g2    Kg1 Rxe1       Kh2 Rh1#.
Now that would have been a tragedy
moves.44... Rd1 45. Rf6+ Ke4 46. Rh6 Rxd7: i am now thinking - don't lose the games you shouldn't
moves.49... g3: this move is where he lost the game for i simply move
moves.50. Rg5: move my rook, his g pawn is lost
moves.51. Kg2 Kf4: i dont want to leave my a pawn unprotected so i will not take the g pawn with my rook
moves.52. Rd5: he resigns. please comment freely. hope you enjoyed
